definitions.definition: A person, especially a minor, both or (rarely) one of whose parents have died.
A person, especially a minor, whose parents have permanently abandoned them.
A young animal with no mother.
Anything that is unsupported, as by its source, provider or caretaker, by reason of the supporter's demise or decision to abandon.
A single line of type, beginning a paragraph, at the bottom of a column or page.
To deprive of parents (used almost exclusively in the passive)
definitions.example: What do you do when you come across two orphaned polar bear cubs?

definitions.definition: To make unavailable, as by removing the last remaining pointer or reference to.
definitions.example: Removing categories orphans pages from the main category tree.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Remaining after the removal of some form of support.
definitions.example: With its government funding curtailed, the gun registry became an orphan program.
